results.title: The Village green
results.brief_description:
Vietnamese poet Huong Trieu worked with ACMI to produce a visual treatment of her poetry about village life in Vietnam. This was part of a VicHealth funded initiative.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: My family
results.brief_description:
After a divorce Nga decides to start life again and migrate to Australia. She reflects on how difficult it is to raise her children alone and how sad she was that she could not afford to give them much and had to work long hours. Nga has come to terms with her guilt and grief when she shares in the successes of her children.
Made at ACMI as part of the ‘Recovering Hope’ Digital Storytelling project, in partnership with VicHealth and Belgium Street Neighbourhood House.

results.title: Time scrambler
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Henriette Simons, Landmark Films and H Simons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
The Time Scrambler has locked five students into a lost time frame. Designed to teach students to use a time line and to recognise sequencing cues in the reading selections. Tells how Prism, an 11 year old alien/teacher instructs his earth students in time sequence when the students become confused about the sequence of events in a story.

results.title: Hope of the future: inferences in reading
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
Prism, a young alien from the planet Reading, is sent to Earth to help five students improve their reading skills. Queen Zoria wants to assign Prism to another planet. The only way he can stay with his Earth friends is to prove that these students understand implied relationships and can read between and beyond the words. In an intense confrontation with Queen Zoria, the students prove their ability to understand inferences. She is so impressed with their excellent comprehension that Prism is permitted to continue his task of developing good readers.

results.title: Turn on the TV in your head
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
Prism, a young alien from the planet Reading, is sent to earth to help five students improve their reading skills. With magical powers he transports them to outer space where he teaches them the importance of concentration and the process of visualisation. With practice the students discover that words can activate the formation of mental pictures. Reading becomes fun when they “turn on the TV in their minds”.

results.title: Individual progress in reading (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Edward Milner, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Reading Development”.
Examines the provision for individual progress in reading at two American schools. Two reading improvement specialists are seen operating different aspects of their respective reading programs. The schools are located on airbases in Oxfordshire.

results.title: Context, concept and structure (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading Development”.
Shows 7-9 year old children from Saffron Green First School, Boreham Wood, England, involved in activities designed to develop intermediate reading skills. Includes sentence building with pictures and phrases; sentence building without pictures; editing a story based on existing sentences; understanding anaphora, structuring an attributes matrix; group working on a cloze passage.
